Skills: spark, scala, data engineering, scalability, pyspark
Description: Greetings from people first consultants!!!!We are looking for Staff data engineer for a leading healthcare company!!!!Location - BangaloreDuties and Responsibilities1. Lead and contribute to the creation of a self-service data platform for reporting and analytics2. Design and build data solutions using Databricks, SQL, Python, Spark, and Delta Lake in the Azure ecosystem (Blob Storage, Data Factory, Event Hubs)3. Ensure best practices for ETL / ELT processes (data quality management, data processing, data partitioning, maintainability and reusability)4. Collaborate with engineers, product, and business leaders to ensure data platform is integrated with other systems and technologies (Tableau, Power BI, APIs, custom applications)5. Establish CI/CD processes, test frameworks, infrastructure-as-code tools, and monitoring/alerting (Git, Terraform, Azure DevOps / GitHub Actions / Jenkins, Azure Monitor / Datadog)6. Adhere to the Code of Conduct and be familiar with all compliance policies and procedures stored in LogixGarden relevant to this positionExperience1. Experience with native and third-party Databricks integrations (Delta Live Tables, Auto Loader, Databricks Workflows / Apache Airflow, Unity Catalog)2. 8+ years data engineering experience3. 3+ years in a senior, staff or principal engineer role4. Experience designing scalable data pipelines5. Experience leading projects within a team and across teams6. Azure experience preferred7. Azure Databricks implementation experience preferred8. Experience designing and implementing data security and governance platform adhering to compliance standards (HIPPA, SOC 2) preferredSpecific Job Knowledge, Skill and Ability1. Strong programming skills in pySpark/Scala2. Strong Dataframe programming skills, such as Spark, Pandas, NumPy3. Passion for mentoring and guiding others4. Strong written and verbal communication skills5. Expert knowledge in architecting, designing and implementing data solutions to serve the needs of our business processes and software products6. Ability to keep security, maintainability, and scalability in mind with the solutions built7. Possess excellent interpersonal communication skills and an aptitude for continued learning

Description: Job Title: Data EngineerLocation:[Bangalore]Job Type:[Full-time]Experience Level:[2-8yrs]About the Role:We are seeking a skilledData Engineerto join our team and help build and maintain robust data pipelines, optimize data processing workflows, and ensure the availability and reliability of data infrastructure. Description: Data Engineer - Req - 1Exp : 5-12 YearsWork Mode : Hybrid (3 Days work from home)Looking for candidates who can join on or before 28th April 25Work Location : Chennai/ Bangalore/ Pune/ Hyderabad/ Jaipur/ GurugramWe are seeking a highly skilledSnowflake Data Engineerto design, implement, and maintain efficient data pipelines on theSnowflake platform. You will work closely with data architects and analysts to integrate, transform, and optimize data for analytics and business intelligence. Proficiency inSQL,Python, andETLprocesses is essential for transforming raw data into actionable insights. Youll be responsible for data modeling, ensuring optimal schema design, and optimizing queries withinSnowflake. Experience withSnowflake's data sharing, streams, tasks, andcloningis a plus. Familiarity withcloud platformslike AWS, Azure, or GCP is required. Youll also be tasked with performance tuning and ensuring data security within Snowflake. Strong understanding ofdata warehousing conceptsand best practices will be key to your success. The ideal candidate is proactive, detail-oriented, and has a passion for solving complex data challenges. If you're looking to work with cutting-edge cloud technologies and big data solutions, wed love to hear from you!Data Engineer - Req 2Exp : 5-12 YearsWork Mode : Hybrid (3 Days work from home).Work Location : Bangalore only (Looking for candidates who are currently at Bangalore only)Looking for candidates who can join on or before 28th April 25We are looking for a talentedData Engineerwith expertise inHadoopandPythonto help build and maintain robust data pipelines. In this role, youll design, implement, and optimize scalable ETL processes to handle large volumes of data. You will work with Hadoop ecosystem tools likeHive,HBase, andSparkto ensure data processing efficiency. Strong skills inPythonscripting for data manipulation and automation are required. Collaborating with data scientists and analysts, you will ensure data integrity and quality for analytics and reporting. Experience withcloud platforms(AWS, Azure, or GCP) anddata warehousingis a plus. Familiarity withNoSQL databasesandbatch processingis desirable. Youll also work on optimizing storage and compute resources in the Hadoop ecosystem. The ideal candidate is a problem solver with a passion for building big data solutions. If you thrive in a fast-paced, data-driven environment, we want to hear from you!

Skills: aws, java, etl, python, spark, flink
Description: Responsibilities:1. Design, develop, and maintain large-scale data pipelines and infrastructure.2. Implement ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to extract data from various sources, transform it into a structured format, and load it into our data warehouse.3. Work with Apache technologies such as Spark, Flink, Kafka, and Lucene to build scalable data processing systems.4. Develop data processing applications using Java and/or Python.5. Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to understand data requirements and develop data pipelines to meet those needs.6. Work with large-scale infrastructure and ensure data pipelines are scalable, efficient, and reliable.7. Ensure data quality and integrity by implementing data validation, data cleansing, and data normalization techniques.8. Familiarity with cloud platforms, mostly AWS, and experience with deploying data pipelines on cloud infrastructure.9. Stay up-to-date with new big data technologies and methodologies and apply that knowledge to improve our data infrastructure.
